intro: Lychnophora syncephala, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is considered a problematic species in some regions.
